content: appears to start successfully, then remove the secondary user messages: ===> set secuser vmlogs off VMLOGS: HCPCFX6769I Your SECUSER terminated by MAINT720. HCPCFX6769I SECUSER of VMLOGS terminated. 10.Enable the automatic logon of the ID during system start-up: ===> dirmaint for autolog1 xautolog add vmlogs ... DVHREQ2289I Your XAUTOLOG request for AUTOLOG1 at * has completed; with RC=0 6.14 z/VM security and hardening The following security and system hardening topics are discussed in this section:  Use an external security manager for correct resource security  Using LOGONBY for correct accountability  High-level z/VM security  Encrypting communications with SSL/TLS on z/VM 6.14.1 Using an external security manager for correct resource security Consider the implementation of a z/VM external security manager (ESM), such as IBM Resource Access Control Facility for z/VM (RACF/VM) or CA VM:Secure. With them, you can correctly implement security policies, such as password
